subject: Management
title: Cultural Dimensions of Conflict
description: A micro-lesson that makes Cultural Dimensions of Conflict usable.

hook.text: A Dutch manager gave blunt feedback to a Japanese colleague. The relationship ruptured instantly.

buildup.text: Direct cultures view open disagreement as honesty. Indirect cultures view it as disrespect.

discovery.text: Erin Meyer's culture map: conflict norms vary dramatically across national and organizational lines.

twist.text: Neither style is wrong. But assuming everyone shares yours guarantees misunderstanding.

climax.text: Learn your team's conflict norms. Adjust your approach. Don't just export your default.

punchline.text: Conflict isn't universal. How people fight is cultural.

quiz.question: How do cultural dimensions affect conflict management?
options: Different cultures have vastly different norms for expressing disagreement
All cultures handle conflict the same way in professional settings
Direct communication is universally the best approach
